segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This tutorial describes how to declare device capabilities in Microsoft Visual Studio.
segment.target: This tutorial describes how to declare device capabilities in Microsoft Visual Studio.

segment.source: This enables your app to use cameras, microphones, location sensors, and other devices.
segment.target: This enables your app to use cameras, microphones, location sensors, and other devices.

segment.source: Specify the device capabilities your app will use
segment.target: Specify the device capabilities your app will use

segment.source: Windows apps require you to specify in the app package manifest when you use certain types of devices.
segment.target: Windows apps require you to specify in the app package manifest when you use certain types of devices.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, you can declare most capabilities by using Manifest Designer or you can add them manually as described in How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest (manually).
segment.target: In Visual Studio, you can declare most capabilities by using Manifest Designer or you can add them manually as described in How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest (manually).

segment.source: This tutorial assumes you're using Manifest Designer.
segment.target: This tutorial assumes you're using Manifest Designer.

segment.source: Some types of devices, such as printers, scanners, and sensors, don't need to be declared in the app package manifest.
segment.target: Some types of devices, such as printers, scanners, and sensors, don't need to be declared in the app package manifest.

segment.source: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, double-click the package manifest file, Package.appxmanifest.
segment.target: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, double-click the package manifest file, Package.appxmanifest.

segment.source: Select the device capabilities that your app uses.
segment.target: Select the device capabilities that your app uses.

segment.source: If you don't see the capability you're looking for in Manifest Designer, add it manually.
segment.target: If you don't see the capability you're looking for in Manifest Designer, add it manually.

segment.source: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest.
segment.target: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest.

segment.source: Allows AllJoyn-enabled apps and devices on a network to discover and interact with each other.
segment.target: Allows AllJoyn-enabled apps and devices on a network to discover and interact with each other.

segment.source: App apps that access APIs in the Windows.Devices.AllJoyn namespace must use this capability.
segment.target: App apps that access APIs in the Windows.Devices.AllJoyn namespace must use this capability.

segment.source: Allows apps to read SMS and MMS messages that have been blocked by the Spam Filter app.
segment.target: Allows apps to read SMS and MMS messages that have been blocked by the Spam Filter app.

segment.source: Allows apps to read and delete Text Messages.
segment.target: Allows apps to read and delete Text Messages.

segment.source: It also allows apps to store chat messages in the system data store.
segment.target: It also allows apps to store chat messages in the system data store.

segment.source: Allows apps to generate code dynamically.
segment.target: Allows apps to generate code dynamically.

segment.source: This capability is subject to the Windows Store policy.
segment.target: This capability is subject to the Windows Store policy.

segment.source: It provides the capability to connect to enterprise intranet resources that require domain credentials.
segment.target: It provides the capability to connect to enterprise intranet resources that require domain credentials.

segment.source: This capability is not typically needed for most apps.
segment.target: This capability is not typically needed for most apps.

segment.source: Provides outbound access to the Internet and networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.
segment.target: Provides outbound access to the Internet and networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.

segment.source: For example, Intranet networks where the user has designated the network as public.
segment.target: For example, Intranet networks where the user has designated the network as public.

segment.source: Most apps that require Internet access should use the capability.
segment.target: Most apps that require Internet access should use the capability.

segment.source: Provides inbound and outbound access to the Internet and the networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.
segment.target: Provides inbound and outbound access to the Internet and the networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.

segment.source: This capability is a superset of Internet (Client).
segment.target: This capability is a superset of Internet (Client).

segment.source: Internet (Client) doesn't need to be enabled if this capability is also enabled.
segment.target: Internet (Client) doesn't need to be enabled if this capability is also enabled.

segment.source: Inbound access to critical ports is always blocked.
segment.target: Inbound access to critical ports is always blocked.

segment.source: Provides access to the current location.
segment.target: Provides access to the current location.

segment.source: This is obtained from dedicated hardware like a GPS sensor in the PC, or derived from available network information.
segment.target: This is obtained from dedicated hardware like a GPS sensor in the PC, or derived from available network information.

segment.source: Provides access to the microphone's audio feed.
segment.target: Provides access to the microphone's audio feed.

segment.source: This allows the app to record from connected microphones.
segment.target: This allows the app to record from connected microphones.

segment.source: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Music Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.
segment.target: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Music Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.

segment.source: Provides programmatic access to the user's 3D Objects, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction.
segment.target: Provides programmatic access to the user's 3D Objects, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction.

segment.source: This capability is typically used in 3D apps and games that need to access the entire 3D Objects library.
segment.target: This capability is typically used in 3D apps and games that need to access the entire 3D Objects library.

segment.source: Allows apps to access all of the phone lines on the device and perform the following functions: place a call on the phone and show the system dialer without prompting the user; access line-related metadata; access line-related triggers.
segment.target: Allows apps to access all of the phone lines on the device and perform the following functions: place a call on the phone and show the system dialer without prompting the user; access line-related metadata; access line-related triggers.

segment.source: Allows the user-selected spam filter app to set and check the block list and call origin information.
segment.target: Allows the user-selected spam filter app to set and check the block list and call origin information.

segment.source: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Pictures Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.
segment.target: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Pictures Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.

segment.source: Provides inbound and outbound access to Intranet networks that have an authenticated domain controller, or that the user has designated as either home or work networks.
segment.target: Provides inbound and outbound access to Intranet networks that have an authenticated domain controller, or that the user has designated as either home or work networks.

segment.source: Inbound access to critical ports is always blocked.
segment.target: Inbound access to critical ports is always blocked.

segment.source: Provides the capability to connect to devices in close proximity to the PC via near-field communication (NFC).
segment.target: Provides the capability to connect to devices in close proximity to the PC via near-field communication (NFC).

segment.source: Near-field proximity may be used to send files or communicate with an app on the nearby device.
segment.target: Near-field proximity may be used to send files or communicate with an app on the nearby device.

segment.source: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files on removable storage devices.
segment.target: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files on removable storage devices.

segment.source: The app can only access the file types on removable storage that are defined in the manifest using the File Type Associations declaration.
segment.target: The app can only access the file types on removable storage that are defined in the manifest using the File Type Associations declaration.

segment.source: The app can't access removable storage on HomeGroup PCs.
segment.target: The app can't access removable storage on HomeGroup PCs.

segment.source: This capability is subject to the Windows Store policy.
segment.target: This capability is subject to the Windows Store policy.

segment.source: It provides the capability to access software and hardware certificates, such as smart card certificates, for validating a user's identity.
segment.target: It provides the capability to access software and hardware certificates, such as smart card certificates, for validating a user's identity.

segment.source: When related APIs are invoked at runtime, the user must take action (insert card, select certificate, etc.).
segment.target: When related APIs are invoked at runtime, the user must take action (insert card, select certificate, etc.).

segment.source: This capability is not necessary if your app includes a private certificate via a Certificates declaration.
segment.target: This capability is not necessary if your app includes a private certificate via a Certificates declaration.

segment.source: Gives apps the ability to access the user's name and picture.
segment.target: Gives apps the ability to access the user's name and picture.

segment.source: This capability is required to access some APIs in the Windows.System.UserProfile namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to access some APIs in the Windows.System.UserProfile namespace.

segment.source: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Videos Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.
segment.target: Provides the capability to add, change, or delete files in the Videos Library for the local PC and HomeGroup PCs.

segment.source: Allows apps to access the VOIP calling APIs in the Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls namespace.
segment.target: Allows apps to access the VOIP calling APIs in the Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls namespace.

segment.source: Provides access to the built-in camera or attached webcam's video feed.
segment.target: Provides access to the built-in camera or attached webcam's video feed.

segment.source: This allows the app to capture snapshots and movies.
segment.target: This allows the app to capture snapshots and movies.

segment.source: Provides access to custom USB devices.
segment.target: Provides access to custom USB devices.

segment.source: This feature is not supported on Windows Phone.
segment.target: This feature is not supported on Windows Phone.

segment.source: Provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID).
segment.target: Provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID).

segment.source: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for HID.
segment.target: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for HID.

segment.source: Provides access to Bluetooth LE devices through a collection of primary services, included services, characteristics, and descriptors.
segment.target: Provides access to Bluetooth LE devices through a collection of primary services, included services, characteristics, and descriptors.

segment.source: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for Bluetooth.
segment.target: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for Bluetooth.

segment.source: Provides access to APIs that support the Basic Rate/Extended Data Rate (BR/EDR) transport and also lets your Windows Store app access a device that implements Serial Port Profile (SPP).
segment.target: Provides access to APIs that support the Basic Rate/Extended Data Rate (BR/EDR) transport and also lets your Windows Store app access a device that implements Serial Port Profile (SPP).

segment.source: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for Bluetooth.
segment.target: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities for Bluetooth.

segment.source: Provides access to Point of Service (POS) barcode scanners and magnetic stripe readers.
segment.target: Provides access to Point of Service (POS) barcode scanners and magnetic stripe readers.

segment.source: This feature is not supported on Windows Phone.
segment.target: This feature is not supported on Windows Phone.

segment.source: Use the Windows Runtime API for communicating with your device
segment.target: Use the Windows Runtime API for communicating with your device

segment.source: The following table connects some of the capabilities to Windows Runtime APIs.
segment.target: The following table connects some of the capabilities to Windows Runtime APIs.

segment.source: See Maps and location overview for more information.
segment.target: See Maps and location overview for more information.
